title: Question 12
prompt: In this diagram of an electric circuit, is the light off or on?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

An electrical circuit is a closed loop of wires that allows electricity to flow from a negative electrical terminal to a positive terminal. The flowing electricity powers electrical equipment such as lights, televisions, and radios. If the circuit is incomplete, the electricity will not flow.
feedback:
As the text describes, if an electrical circuit is incomplete, the electricity will not flow and cannot power the light. When the switch is open, the light is off.


An electrical circuit is a closed loop of wires that allows electricity to flow from a negative electrical terminal to a positive terminal. The flowing electricity powers electrical equipment such as lights, televisions, and radios. If the circuit is incomplete, the electricity will not flow.
